ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained an in-depth understanding of the culture and history of South Africa and a very solid foundation of the Zulu language.
I learned the basics and core of the Zulu language, as well as the history of the language and the people that spoke it. I also learned a lot about the country of South Africa.
This class helps you really learn a lot about the culture surrounded by Isizulu.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The teacher, or as we call her, "Thisha," is amazing at teaching Zulu. When I talk about the class, I usually refer to it as a history class where we learn the language as well because she does such a great job making the course comprehensive and engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this class to another student. It's an amazing way to learn about a completely different culture, and I couldn't recommend Thisha more highly as a professor.
This class provides an opportunity to learn about a wonderful language and culture. The professor is fantastic and will make you love the class. I definitely recommend this class.
